text: Using med-high heat coat the bottom of your sauté pan with olive oil. Add garlic and stir to translucent. Add pasta and stir continuously to slightly soften. Do not brown the garlic or the pasta. Pour in the wine and stir until completely absorbed.  Gradually add your chicken stock, about 2-4 oz. at a time depending on the size of your pan. Stir frequently so the pasta does not stick.  Repeat the process of adding chicken stock until pasta is al dente or to your desired doneness. Lower your heat to med-low. Add cream and cook until it is reduced. Now you can add your basil pesto and cheese. Stir all of your ingredients until creamy.  Garnish with basil chiffonade and shredded parmesan.
